mission.name: Artemis II
mission.description: NASA's first crewed mission beyond Earth orbit in over 50 years. Four astronauts will orbit the Moon and return, testing critical systems for future lunar landings.

milestones.name: LAUNCH
milestones.description: SLS liftoff from Launch Complex 39B at Kennedy Space Center

milestones.name: ORBIT INSERTION
milestones.description: Orion spacecraft achieves stable Earth orbit

milestones.name: TRANS-LUNAR INJECTION
milestones.description: Upper stage burn sends Orion toward the Moon

milestones.name: LUNAR FLYBY
milestones.description: Orion spacecraft flies past the Moon at closest approach, approximately 7,400 miles from lunar surface

milestones.name: EARTH RETURN
milestones.description: Orion splashdown in the Pacific Ocean after 10-day mission

fallbackNews.title: Artemis II Crew Completes Final Launch Simulation
fallbackNews.summary: The four astronauts of Artemis II have successfully completed their final full-duration launch countdown simulation at Kennedy Space Center, a major milestone before their lunar flyby mission.

fallbackNews.title: NASA Prepares for Artemis II Crewed Lunar Flyby
fallbackNews.summary: Teams at Kennedy Space Center continue integration of the Space Launch System rocket and Orion spacecraft for the first crewed flight beyond Earth orbit in over 50 years.

fallbackNews.title: Artemis II: Testing Orion for Future Lunar Missions
fallbackNews.summary: The Artemis II mission will test all critical systems aboard the Orion spacecraft with crew, validating life support, navigation, and communication systems for future missions.

fallbackNews.title: Artemis II Crew Announced for Historic Lunar Flyby
fallbackNews.summary: NASA reveals the four astronauts who will journey around the Moon on Artemis II, becoming the first humans to travel beyond Earth orbit since Apollo 17.

fallbackNews.title: Lunar Flyby: Artemis II's Path Around the Moon
fallbackNews.summary: Scientists explain the trajectory for Artemis II, which will take the crew within 7,400 miles of the lunar surface before returning to Earth.

fallbackImages.title: Artemis I Launch
fallbackImages.description: Space Launch System rocket lifts off from Kennedy Space Center

fallbackImages.title: Orion Spacecraft
fallbackImages.description: Orion spacecraft captured in lunar orbit during Artemis I

fallbackImages.title: SLS on Launch Pad
fallbackImages.description: Space Launch System rocket at Launch Complex 39B

fallbackImages.title: Artemis Crew Training
fallbackImages.description: Astronauts train for lunar surface operations

fallbackImages.title: Moon from Orion
fallbackImages.description: The Moon as seen from Orion spacecraft

fallbackImages.title: Orion and Earth
fallbackImages.description: Earth rises behind Orion spacecraft during Artemis I
